授業目的: The purpose of this course is to train students as strategy planners. The course is designed to enable students to be familiar with alternative firm or business strategies. We also discuss how to effectively implement alternative strategies by ensuring appropriate selection of skills, expertise, resources, organizational structure, incentive & control mechanisms. The course also covers discussions on how strategic thinking relates to other major disciplines, including marketing as well as finance.
到達目標: Learning goals of this course are twofold. Firstly, students should be able to generate realistic and effective strategic alternatives for their organizations by considering their competitive contexts, available resources, as well as goals and missions of their organizations. Secondly, students should be able to articulate differential profit potential and associated risks of those strategic alternatives. Students will be encouraged to pay close attention to the challenge of implementing new strategic initiatives while they sustain smooth and efficient operation of ongoing business.

第1回: Positioning-based view (1): After a quick introduction of the course, we start the course by discussing what strategy planners should clarify to design effective strategy. We then examine one of the most fundamental typologies of competitive strategy. We will discuss aims, typical initiatives involved, competitive contexts, as well as challenges associated with the cost leadership strategy and the differentiation strategy, respectively.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第2回: Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第3回: Positioning-based view (2):  In the second session, we will discuss how to organize for effective implementation of the cost leadership strategy, as well as the differentiation strategy, respectively. The discussion is designed to characterize the two strategic alternatives as polar opposites, thereby showing the rationale why they should not be pursued simultaneously.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第4回: Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第5回: Resource-based view: One of the most critical critiques against the positioning-based view is that it ignores uniqueness of each organization, or an underlying rationale why one organization is more competitive than others. A resource-based view addresses this shortfall by analyzing organizations as bundle of unique resources. We introduce this approach employed for examining the source of competitiveness by discussing a mechanisms of diversification strategy.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第6回: Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第7回: Knowledge-based view: As one of the most important resources, we focus on knowledge of organizations in the fourth session. We will reconcile seemingly contradictory perspectives on strategy, i.e., the positioning-based view and the resource-based view, by showing that valuable and unique knowledge, which can only be defined as so by considering competitive positioning, enables both the cost leadership strategy and the differentiation strategy.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第8回: Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第9回: Organizations are not always fortunate enough to have all resources required to implement their intended strategy. Accordingly, managers sometimes consider complementing available resources by alliances or M&As (mergers and acquisitions). We also extend our discussion beyond the combination of resources by examining how organizations can leverage its structural position in the network of allied organizations as their source of additional competitive advantage.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第10回: Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
第11回: I the sixth session, we will discuss why, rather than how, an organization employs one strategy than the other. In other words, the foregoing discussions are motivated by the question, "why one organization is more competitive than the others?", while more informative question for strategy planners may be "how should one select from several alternative strategies?". This is an important issue to understand the reason why organizations may select (in)appropriate strategy, given their available resources, competitive requirements, and strategic goals.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.

第13回: We conclude the course by discussing some emerging streams of science of strategy, including resource orchestration, effectuation, and organizational ambidexterity.
Read assigned academic journal article(s). Read case materials and prepare for class discussion.
